Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Preoperative Smoking Cessation Interventions

Trial_Design.evidence: This systematic review included randomised controlled trials (RCTs) and non-RCTs.

Participants.evidence: Eligible participants were smokers aged over 18 scheduled for elective surgery.

Intervention.evidence: The intervention group received preoperative smoking cessation support, while the control group received usual care.

Objective.evidence: This study assesses the impact of preoperative smoking cessation interventions on smoking abstinence and postoperative outcomes.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was smoking cessation at surgery time and at the last follow-up.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation and allocation concealment methods were not specified.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Sixteen studies (3505 participants) were included, with 14 RCTs (2940 participants) in the meta-analysis.

Number_Analysed.evidence: The analysis was conducted using an intention-to-treat approach.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The intervention group showed significantly increased odds of quitting smoking at surgery time (RR 1.64, 95% CI 1.30–2.07) and at the longest follow-up (RR 1.38, 95% CI 1.12–1.70).
